alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Frederick; Shenandoah; Warren (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 2:28PM EST until January 17 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM SUNDAY TO 7 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow changing to ice. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of up to one quarter of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Virginia and panhandle West Virginia. * WHEN...From 1 PM Sunday to 7 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow may fall at 1 to 3 inches per hour for a time late Sunday, making roads nearly impassable for a time.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
